website_summaries.verdict: Fast-freezing, stainless steel molds create tasty desserts; slips out of molds fast.
pros: Final popsicles look better than store-bought
cons: Possible learning curve when first trying them

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Do not recommend. I am returning these. Metal cover was not properly treated so black came off all over everything. Needless to say this product cant be safe for food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love that it makes Popsicles that look store bought
customer_reviews.text: I love that it makes Popsicles that look store bought. Getting the Popsicles out of the mold takes more time than any other mold that I have used. The sticks that came with it fit perfect. But when I ran out of them and used store bought Popsicles sticks, I actually had to sand them down because they wouldn't fit into the mold lid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: takes some getting used to
customer_reviews.text: It is super tricky to get the popsicle sticks to go straight up and down and if they get crooked in the freezing process then they are too short to hold really well when you eat the popsicle. That having been said they are still better than trying to track down the plastic handles that come with other popsicle maligning sets I've owned.
customer_reviews.author: Lillie M

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: You just have to make sure you buy the right size popsicle sticks....the ones that come with are 3/8" by 4.5". I'm ordering the 1000 count food grade sticks by fedmax. They should be the right size. Attached pics of the originals for reference. I had no problems taking off the top or removing the popsicles.
customer_reviews.author: West

customer_reviews.title: Flawed design; buy something else.
customer_reviews.text: The design is fundamentally flawed. The popsicle sticks don't stay vertical in the popsicles while they freeze (they go into a liquid and there is no way to fix them to stay vertical short of perhaps taping them in place). When they are frozen, and the sticks are at different angles (not perpendicular), it is extremely difficult to remove the metal top, the popsicles break and for some of the popsicles the popsicle sticks come out without the popsicle. Don't waste your time or money.
customer_reviews.author: Scott E Wonder

customer_reviews.title: ... maker it does its job but the quality is bad. After you wash it weird black staff comes ...
customer_reviews.text: As popsicle maker it does its job but the quality is bad. After you wash it weird black staff comes out from metal part. I don't think it is good for health. I returned this product.
customer_reviews.author: O G

customer_reviews.title: Lid hard to remove once frozen
customer_reviews.text: The metal lid is hard to remove after popsicles have frozen. I sliced the tip of my finger while removing and didn’t notice until I saw blood on two of the popsicles. Needless to say I had to throw away. I would recommend another type of lid or add something to edges or some kind of edge you can grip to prevent slicing finger. Next time I remove, I’ll wear gloves or just put plastic wrap over top and slices holes for sticks.
customer_reviews.author: Rrtdat

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: This is my third or fourth set of popsicle molds, and it is by far the best one! The aluminum frame give sturdiness, but the food does not come in contact with it. I love the traditional popsicle shape, too. I have frozen one batch and taken the popsicles out (just a few seconds dipped in warm water and they slip right out) to store in zip bags while I get ready to make another batch. When the grandkids come, I will be ready! Also, I can enjoy them myself anytime I'm feeling need for a refreshing treat!
customer_reviews.author: Sandie Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Love this Popcycle maker.
customer_reviews.text: Love this one have four of them now with peach strawberry and watermelon icecream pops in the freezer right now, getting ready to make blueberry ones today. I'm diabetic so can use stevia in place of regular sugars so I can enjoy icecream without the sugar alcohol which causes me problems in store bought sugar free icecream.
customer_reviews.author: Patsy McLoed

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful mold
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality control. The metal lid that came with the mold arrived bent. I was able to straighten it out so it properly fit onto the mold. I love how easy it is to use to make my frozen Greek strawberry yogurt bars. However, I wish it included more popsicle sticks. You have to remember to immerse the mold in a bath of hot water for about 30 seconds in order to get whatever you freeze out of the mold.
customer_reviews.author: Don Young

customer_reviews.title: Poorly constructed and rusty inside
customer_reviews.text: This item was not well made. The openings that hold the individual pops were uneven sizes, resulting in the pops being held at different heights and some hanging at an angle rather than sitting flat. Some of the popsicle containers were rusty inside, and one looked like it had dried food stuck in it!? My family was worried this item might not be truly food safe. We are returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Hutchison

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love it works great. I haven’t had the issue with the discolored “sludge” or whatever it was that other negative reviews have mentioned. I’ve made lots of fresh fruit popsicles so far this summer for my kids to enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: S. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Great mold!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is great pop mold. The only issue I had with it is if you don't have the sticks completely straight, the lid is not forgiving. Any slight angle and the lid is stick on.
customer_reviews.author: Marlo Waldrop

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: These are seriously the best molds out there. They are pricey but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product. Have made several batches of ice pops and will tell my friends of this great purchase and have them give them a try.
customer_reviews.author: evie

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to Use
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product, but it is extremely difficult to use. The popsicles are almost impossible to remove. I still havent gotten some of the holders out of the fitting. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: t.rector

customer_reviews.title: Pops
customer_reviews.text: Hard to get the ice cream out but still good buy
customer_reviews.author: Sandy H.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Really easy to use although I almost gave it 4 stars since no directions included. popsicles come out easily.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I've become addicted to fruit pops but most of the home sets have plastic sticks that you have to remember to bring home to reuse. I wanted something where I could make bars to go. This is perfect. Makes ten good size pops at a time. If you want to unmold them all at once they fit perfectly into the snack size ziploc bags. For anyone worried about the aluminum . . . unless you overfill it never touches the pop.
customer_reviews.author: Kim E

customer_reviews.title: No fuss no muss frozen treats
customer_reviews.text: It exceeded all expectations. I have made pudding pops filled with goodies. Un like some others it's very easy to slide your pop out. With the wooden sticks you never have to worry if one is lost like the plastic ones that are part of the cover. love it , love it.
customer_reviews.author: deezer

customer_reviews.title: I does the job and it's fun making healthy Popsicles (paletas)
customer_reviews.text: I does the job and it's fun making healthy Popsicles (paletas). My one complaint is that the sticks don't stay upright (they will tilt a little bit when it's in the freezer) and that makes it hard to take off the top. Otherwise, it okay.
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: Pudding pop lover!
customer_reviews.text: I can't have dairy so I make my own pudding pops from Chocolate Avocado Puddomg Recipe using coconut milk and coconut sugar! Yum! Now when everyone has their ice cream, I get mine too!! Good size pops and easily removed. Don't push the sticks all the way in.
customer_reviews.author: D. B.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I love these. I have plenty of recipes, I just need to choose which ones to use.
customer_reviews.author: Rosebud

customer_reviews.title: Strong molds and with a little warm water placed in ...
customer_reviews.text: Strong molds and with a little warm water placed in a tray the ice cream came out by slowly pulling on the sticks.
customer_reviews.author: mapembert

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Love the stability of the molds—the cover is very hard to release though! Will not stop me from using it though—looking forward to trying out new popsicles !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got my ice pop maker yesterday and what a nice set. It was here a little early than ...
customer_reviews.text: Got my ice pop maker yesterday and what a nice set. It was here a little early than I thought so I used it right away. I did have some trouble getting my soap popsicles out but after a little reading found the perfect way to get them out. Love this mold.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria Ross

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! The molds are a little hard to take out but overall pretty good product.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Nice pop maker
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and the stick guide is a nice feature. I really wanted something that I could use with wooden sticks. These come out looking very "authentic"...not homemade.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan G.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Good product. I haven’t used many others to compare but I like it and it was easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa K.

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly awesome. I overfilled the molds
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly awesome. I overfilled the molds, but no worries. I just ran it under water to loosen. I make awesome yogurt pops with fruit in them. Yummy
customer_reviews.author: kathleen natale

customer_reviews.title: Great Pop Maker
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first pop maker, but it will probably be the last. My first pop maker was a real disaster. The shape of the pops made it difficult to remove the pops first, then the 'reusable' plastic 'sticks' started to disappear, making the whole thing unusable. In contrast, this pop maker has angled sides that make removal easy and the wooden sticks can be thrown away or washed and reused. I bought a box of sticks and I don't care if the sticks get lost or thrown away. Also the 3 ounce size per pop is perfect. I have used these for mildly alcoholic pops and also for dessert pops. The whole family loves these.
customer_reviews.author: ARO

customer_reviews.title: This product is amazing. Very well made - sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing. Very well made - sturdy!!! My kids love my homemade fruit sickles that I can't keep them made 😊
customer_reviews.author: AngelaAdkins

customer_reviews.title: The item came at a reasonable time.
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, I am in need of another
customer_reviews.author: keishla collins

customer_reviews.title: Hard to get out
customer_reviews.text: Popsicle looks really good but it was actually hard getting them out. I had to dip in warm water everytime I wanted one which was a pain.
customer_reviews.author: campogrl

customer_reviews.title: These molds are really great, and so was the price
customer_reviews.text: I am really enjoying my frozen creations. These molds are really great, and so was the price.
customer_reviews.author: Linda S

customer_reviews.title: Scienc Project
customer_reviews.text: Haven't had a chance to use them yet but my grand daughter is using them in a Science project for school.
customer_reviews.author: thered9

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Popsicles
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase. Arrived on time and was exactly as described. This makes the perfect Popsicles! I would recommend this to everyone who is looking for a homemade Popsicle maker.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Auten

customer_reviews.title: Good-bye to store-bought ice cream
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Buy more sticks right now because you're going to want to use this all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Trickylew

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this product ! It's easy to clean and easy to use. Just received it on Friday and I already made 2 batches of fruit, yogurt, silk milk pops! #healthysnacking Perfect to get the vitamins I need. And my family loves it as well. Already thinking of my next recipe:)
customer_reviews.author: MS.EliBellyCupcakes

customer_reviews.title: I love this pop tray!
customer_reviews.text: I just started making my own juice/frozen fruit pops because I was disenchanted by the amount of sugar added to all commercially bought pops. This tray is amazing! It didn't come with any instructions, but I found some sites online (www.peoplespops.com/) that will give you hints. And not that I needed any -- one quick dunk in warm water and they "pop" right out! They are the perfect size to store in the snack-size plastic zipper bags if you're not planning on eating them all right away.
customer_reviews.author: Matisse Norton

customer_reviews.title: Family love it and so easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Homemade popsicles so much flavors and healthier. Family love it and so easy to clean
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Lacopo

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have a problem with the sticks not fitting (as read in the other reviews). Good quality mold. The popsicles release easily and look perfect. The mold is easy to clean (just a few rinses).
customer_reviews.author: janek

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Loved it, the popsicle came out beautiful. Easy to use, no mess, doesn't stick.
customer_reviews.author: selvin vargas

customer_reviews.title: easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Popsicles freeze very quickly, easy to clean. I wish they weren't as thin.
customer_reviews.author: ESee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent popsicle maker , a must have for the summertime !!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent , better than what i expected . Wuality is high . Going to be ordering a 2nd set real soon . One for the adults and one for the children . Would definately recommend .
customer_reviews.author: john s.

customer_reviews.title: Love this mold
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived more quickly than actually promised, which was great. Made great hibiscus lemonade popsicles with it so far. Easy to remove from mold. Having a little difficulty figuring out how to keep the sticks straight. Any suggestions for that would be appreciated. This is my first Popsicle mold and love the fact that the popsicle is completely removable, as opposed to the kind that uses a plastic stick that is part of the mold. This allows me to make many in a short period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Mea Foodie

customer_reviews.title: They are the perfect size and easier to get out than I thought ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I could make yogurt pops for my grandson. They are the perfect size and easier to get out than I thought they would be. I make them ahead and then wrap them in plastic wrap and store in the freezer in a large ziplock bag. This way I always have them on hand for him when he wants a treat.
customer_reviews.author: Carol 1023

customer_reviews.title: A good item
customer_reviews.text: It was better then I thought it would be, just needed more sticks. I think I will buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene G Davis

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money. Get extra sticks from this website ...
customer_reviews.text: Worth the money. Get extra sticks from this website...I got sticks locally in India and they do not fit the hole on the cover.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: It's good
customer_reviews.text: Product was as I expected. The popsicles are a little tough to get out once it's all frozen but I imagine it's like that with all the other popsicle making contraptions
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: While it makes and is a great mold, holds the sticks in well, the molds barely come out of the holder. Frozen or not, they barely budge which makes it hard to put the molds in warm water and remove them...let alone if your fingers are wet they stuck to the aluminum...christmas story style
customer_reviews.author: Seth

customer_reviews.title: I bought this product and put it in dish washer ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product and put it in dish washer to clean properly before I use. The metal part turned in to Greg color.When I wiped with kitchen towels, black metal liquid comes out and didn't stopped. I felt it's so toxic material to be used for food. I couldn't find the box or instruction were written no dish washer and still felt not appropriate item to be used for food making...
customer_reviews.author: soojin kang

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!
customer_reviews.text: The lid is fairly difficult to get off, but the moulds themselves are perfect. It is exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Gray

customer_reviews.title: Awful Sticks don't fit
customer_reviews.text: Have used this product twice and both times it has failed. The wooden pop-sticks don't fit into lid so you can't get them done in popsicle base. And if you push/force them down, you won't be able to get the lid off. Not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: holly l smith

customer_reviews.title: Terrible item
customer_reviews.text: Terrible item. Was so excited to make homemade popsicles but ended up getting blisters from trying to pull it out of the molder. If I let t has a little the whole stick would pop out. Such a waste. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Wasted too much money
customer_reviews.text: Product is too difficult to use, ie., removing the popsicles and cost too much AND I bought 2 of them... for each house. Both have already gone to a 2nd hand store. In addition regular size popsicle sticks don't fit!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Hard to remove pops
customer_reviews.text: It's so hard to get the pops out of this! I think it's so cute but by the time the pops are unfrozen enough to come out they are almost melted. A little disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Davis

customer_reviews.title: Boo
customer_reviews.text: If anyone can get the frozen product out intact you're a better person than I am. What a waste of time, product and money.
customer_reviews.author: Tova R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I saw these on MarthaStewart.com with a fudgesicle recipe. FANTASTIC!
customer_reviews.author: Philip K. & Lori Works

customer_reviews.title: These are great but taking the pops out after being frozen is ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great but taking the pops out after being frozen is quite a tough job. I love the classic mold.
customer_reviews.author: kesia ochoa

customer_reviews.title: The item came with no instruction, I had to ...
customer_reviews.text: The item came with no instruction, I had to get the info from amazon help and I was given the how to The fact that you have to run the mold under hot water in order to released the popsicle I regret I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: sylj

customer_reviews.title: NOT dishwasher safe and no istructions
customer_reviews.text: I have used this once and it worked well, however, it didn't come with instructions and I just followed the questions section at Amazon and washed it top rack in the dishwasher. The top(that comes in contact with the plastic) is BLACK and is coming off into the molds. Not sure if this would have happened had I not put it in the dishwasher but now I cannot use it again for fear of what will be leeching into the pop cycles.
customer_reviews.author: LeslieR

customer_reviews.title: perfect product for household
customer_reviews.text: almost 5 stars,perfect product for household,but im looking a size a little bit biger for sale homemade ice pops
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, arrived 1 week early and have no fuss with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: blah blah blah I need 15 words in the headline blah blah blah 3 more blah blah blah blah blah!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: perfect size and easy to un-mold, blah blah I do these to help, now if you are going to make me add more words I will stop participating.
customer_reviews.author: Donald B. Lane

customer_reviews.title: Cool Concept, but didn't work out for me.
customer_reviews.text: So, the concept is awesome. But the way this was made, defeats the purpose. I got these thinking I could make healthier Popsicles and also save a few dollars here and there. But once I made them and froze them, they are impossible to pop out in one piece. You end up with a slushie instead of a popsicle. Ha! If they were made of a flexible bendable plastic, it would have been worth the money. Just didn't work for me. Wish I didn't throw out the box, so I could return it. The transaction was smooth. Shipping was quick and easy. But the product itself, I could do with out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Popsicle
customer_reviews.text: Made mangoe pops sprinkled tajin. I like the popcile sticks so I don't meet to worry about losing parts. Easy to pop out once you run warm water under for a few seconds
customer_reviews.author: Mariel D.

customer_reviews.title: Great value if you can get them for 11 or ...
customer_reviews.text: I use these all the time for our commercial popsicle business. Great value if you can get them for 11 or 12 dollars. Sometimes they go up over 20 dollars. I wouldn't purchase them at that price.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Black stuff comes off after washing
customer_reviews.text: The frame oxidizes after washing and turns black -- impossible to clean. The black stuff smells of aluminum on the towel, don't know what it really contains, definitely don't want it touching the ice cream. There is also a mold that looks exactly the same selling for $15.92 from another vendor:  Update 6/28/2020: That mold for $15.92 is now $24 -- price was changed since few days ago when I posted review.
customer_reviews.author: HV

customer_reviews.title: Unmolding and wrapping is my issue
customer_reviews.text: These make adorable paletas. The molds are sturdy and wash up well in the dishwasher. Having said that... I find having to remove and wrap all 10 popsicles at a time aggravating. It’s my fault for not processing that would need to happen. Didnt think that through. Having to dip the pan in warm water to remove them made a few of my ends melt. Probably more operator error then an issue with the mold. I find the zoku brand popsicle molds suit my needs better as I can remove one at a time. I would purchase this mold again knowing what I know because it is good quality. I have had no issues with the metal.
customer_reviews.author: WP

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy metal cover; hard to release
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. The cover is very thin and will bend if you aren't careful. The molds are pretty thick plastic, which means it takes more time and effort to get your pops out. Also, the stick slots don't hold the sticks in place very well, so they will "float" some in thinner bases, which means a lot of crooked sticks unless you tape them all together.
customer_reviews.author: R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Amongst the rest, these truly are the best! At first I had some trouble with getting the pops out and one or two broke in half. Then I ran the base in a little bit of cool water, they released right out! I love it! I will continue using this over and over! I made some creamy fruit popsicles in it and for my family store bought pops are a thing of the past!
customer_reviews.author: Pharmfem2012

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the sturdiness of this container. It uses a metal frame to prevent the plastic holders from falling over. The wells are good size compared to the cheap ones I purchased last summer. I prefer wooden sticks because they seem to have a better grip on the frozen product as compared to the plastic sticks.
customer_reviews.author: C. France

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love this but Ive used it twice & can't get ...
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to love this but Ive used it twice & can't get the sticks to stay straight in the mold when placing in the freezer. They float a little to the sides making it very hard to get the lid off to release the frozen bars. I bent the heck out of it to get em out...Maybe it's just me. But I think the sticks need a more stable guide slot.
customer_reviews.author: LisaW

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Super easy to clean. Popsicle is a breeze to release. No plastic taste. Definitely a great value for the money. Wish I had bought them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Sabo

customer_reviews.title: These are great
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much, easy to clean. A tip when using them, don’t put them in warm water to get them out. It just ruins the tip of the popsicle. I set them on the counter for 10 min and them pull them out
customer_reviews.author: Keto Alice

customer_reviews.title: These are worth the buy
customer_reviews.text: These are the best! Instead of buying them at the store, you can make your own healthy popsicles. The cover is difficult to remove after it freezes
customer_reviews.author: Tiny Tina

customer_reviews.title: We have only used this a couple of times. ...
customer_reviews.text: We have only used this a couple of times. It's really difficult to get the popsicles out. If you don't soak them in just the right temperature water for just the right amount of time, you end up only getting half of a popsicle out (or you end up getting the stick, but not the popsicle). Also, the sticks that come with this do not actually fit in slots in the lid. We had to buy different popsicle sticks to make this work.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Love this popsicle mold
customer_reviews.text: Love this popsicle mold! I have others that have plastic handles but they get lost. So nice to use wooden popsicle sticks and I love that you can make 12 popsicles at once for pennies on the dollar. Sturdy construction and easy to put together. Would totally recommend!
customer_reviews.author: L Kris

customer_reviews.title: Great product but a bit tricky to clean
customer_reviews.text: Love that it can make 10 pops at a time yet takes the same amount of room in the freezer as most other Popsicle makers that yield less. High quality materials and very durable, we go through a lot of Popsicles. Only catch is, it is a bit cumbersome to clean. It is difficult to pop each mold out to clean properly - you really have to bend the mold and force it out. I'm still going to buy another order of these as they are perfect otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger

customer_reviews.title: So happy with this product, beautiful popsicles.
customer_reviews.text: So easy to use & fill. Once frozen give some counter time and the popsicles slide out easily and whole. The popsicles fit perfectly in fold-top sandwich bags. I've noticed the network cooking channel shows that feature gourmet popsicles are using this maker. With all the available recipes I'm going to be ready with dozens for Summer!!
customer_reviews.author: GPainter

customer_reviews.title: this will be perfect. Five stars because I'm not faulting the product ...
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to remove the top if the popsicle sticks don't freeze exactly upright. Once i overcome that obstacle, this will be perfect. Five stars because I'm not faulting the product for human error.
customer_reviews.author: aj

customer_reviews.title: This a sturdy popsicle maker
customer_reviews.text: This a sturdy popsicle maker. We love it for making fruit infused bars. Nice size. We use cellophane pouches to wrap the bars, once removed from the mold. Excellent product
customer_reviews.author: Bettyarnold

customer_reviews.title: Love them! You need to run the frozen pops ...
customer_reviews.text: Love them! You need to run the frozen pops under hot water for a few seconds but no longer or they will melt and make your pops look ugly. Once you've run them under hot water, just give them a firm tug and they will pop right out! I purchased ten of these and love them!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is very sturdy but a little challenging on the cleaning. I think is a good portion size. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okee dokee
customer_reviews.text: I took off one star for the aluminum, not stainless top. However, the popsicles never come in contact with anything but the sticks. Have made 20 popsicles so far and have no comlaints on the performance for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Suzan T

customer_reviews.title: Nice and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy, but the pop cycle sticks do not stay straight, which then makes taking the top off after frozen, very difficult. Need to improve
customer_reviews.author: Intenseitalian

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well, daughter makes frozen yogurt pops and we seal them up in vacuum bags for individual servings.
customer_reviews.author: labillyboy

customer_reviews.title: The best treats are the ones you make yourself
customer_reviews.text: These trays are constantly being filled and emptied in our home making yogurt Popsicle's and other treats. What a great project for your little kitchen helpers. Take your favorite juices, yogurt, or smoothie recipe and simply toss it in the freezer. The metal cover holds the stick perfectly in place until frozen and you can stash them in ziplock bags for those times when you want a treat. You are in control of what you put in them so if your health conscience, try some cucumber/carrot/spinach juice pop's or fresh fruit juice. You are only limited by your imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn Johnson

customer_reviews.title: works fine if you have the right recipe
customer_reviews.text: works fine if you have the right recipe. the trick is to quickly dunk in warm water to remove the pops. I put them in sandwich bags to store in the freezer.
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love making popsicles. It is a bit difficult to get them out of the mold sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: McKenzie

customer_reviews.title: I'm thrilled with these!
customer_reviews.text: I am now able to make my own popsicles! After washing the mold I made 5 banana/coconut milk/almond milk and 5 strawberry. SOOOO YUMMY! Then I made 5 lemonade and 5 blueberry. It is so nice to know exactly what is in my popsicle! The only issue I have is that the sticks (that came with it) don't fit through the slots. I had to put a plastic bag over the top, use the metal top as a guide, punch holes through the plastic, then insert the sticks through the holes. The sticks don't remain steady in the center of the pop; but I can deal with it. Hoping they make the holes bigger in the guide in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Raglandjs

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful and easy to use. A bit challenging to clean but I use a clean brush to get into the crevices. I have 5 units and love them. I will order more without hesitation!
customer_reviews.author: Allen London

customer_reviews.title: Makes healthy frozen treats for the kids and adults!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very impressed! I like to eat healthy so I can put in healthy stuff! My wife has been making fruit sorbet. An easy one is take a pound of blue berries wash and put in the freezer. Take 2 bananas peel, slice and freeze. After frozen put in food processor along with 1/4 cup of honey or agave. Spoon into popsicle maker add sticks and freeze. Run under warm water for 10-15 seconds to demold. She just made a batch of peach/banana! Yum!
customer_reviews.author: James Jones

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be an easy way to make a lot of popsicles at one time. You can make a lot, but it's not easy. Sorry I spent my money on it.
customer_reviews.author: KPHawaii

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, you cannot get the silver top off after it freezes
customer_reviews.author: Loretta

customer_reviews.title: I love this product
customer_reviews.text: I love this product! The only thing is making sure to line up the popsicle sticks just right or the top will not come off easy
customer_reviews.author: Silly Mama

customer_reviews.title: Had fun with it a few times.
customer_reviews.text: Had fun with it a few times. Pretty basic construction makes it difficult to go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: RobCCR

customer_reviews.title: Frozen pop maker is easy to use and more sturdy than most
customer_reviews.text: Frozen pop maker is easy to use and more sturdy than most. Somewhat difficult to make the sticks stand up straight in liquid phase.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Lid does not fit sticks that came with it.
customer_reviews.text: We like the mold and it works well with one exception. The openings in the cover are too small for the sticks provided or a second bag we purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Shelton

product_meta.title: Fox Run Stainless Steel Popsicle Mold, Set of 6, Silver
product_meta.description: Style Name:Stainless SteelMade from 18/8 stainless steel, this fast freeze mold is easy to use, easy to clean, and will last you a life time. Designed so that one ice pop can be removed (or re-filled) at a time. Simply hold the mold in your hand for a moment, or run under Warm water briefly. (Not too long, It will release very quickly. ) each set comes with one stand, 6 molds, 6 lids, 12 removable silicone rings, and a set of 50 reusable bamboo sticks. The rings ensure proper stick placement. No more tilted stick, or Sunken sticks Or popped out sticks.
feature_bullets: Fill with juice, puree, yogurt, apple Sauce, ice cream and more for a refreshing treat! Get creative and make frozen wine slushies, Cocktail or cocktails to refresh and delight at your next party!
Made from durable and safe 18/8 stainless steel, BPA-free, use with confidence!
Conveniently designed so that one ice pop can be removed (or re-filled) at a time
Makes 6 classic paddle style ice pops just like the old days; make summer family time special for kids and adults!
Bonus* comes with 50 free reusable bamboo popsicle sticks
Overall Dimensions: 5. 25" D x 6" W x 7. 25" H
